title: FurKids
body:
Do you love dogs or cats? Then volunteering at furkids is the place for you!!

  • Furkids is a dog/cat rescue shelter and their mission is to to rescue homeless animals, provide them with the best medical care and nurturing environment while working to find them a forever home! 

  • As a volunteer caretaker, you will need to clean/maintain the shelter and give the kittens well deserved love and care. This is also a great family opportunity! 

  • Volunteer shifts are Monday-Friday 10AM-1PM and Sat & Sun from 9 AM to 12 noon.

title: Schoolhouse Tutoring
body: School House a free online tutoring opportunity where you can choose to get certified in anything and have you own flexible schedule. The current focus is high school math and SAT reading & writing, and a few AP classes  with plans to expand to other areas soon.

title: Meals by Grace
body:
Meals by Grace is a non profit organization that brings food, hope, and transformation to children and families in need.


Volunteer events on the calendar include

  • Kitchen Prep

  • Pantry Stocking

  • Meal Delivery

  • Amazon Sorting Days

 

This is a great way to get service hours that personally work for you!

title: Keep Forsyth County Beautiful
body:
• Join us in the annual Shore Sweep and help pick up trash on the shoreline of Lake Lanier!

  • The Shore Sweep is taking place on September 24th from 8 - 11 AM 

  • Las year, over 1,200 volunteers attended and over 85 tons of debris and trash were removed from the lake!

  • All volunteers will receive a Shore Sweep shirt.

  • Volunteers can receive up to 3 hours for participating throughout the entire event.

title: Agape Hospice Cards
body:
We are continuing our support and collecting cards for Agape hospice center! 

Guidelines:

  • Handwriting is large and readable

  • Do not put a date or an address

  • Be KIND with your words

  • Share your story :)

  • Please put effort into this!! We want hospice patients to feel loved and appreciated so no plain white paper- something like colored paper would be nice. 

    • 2 cards = 1 hour

    • Max of 2 hours (4 cards)

    • Submit a picture of yourself and the cards to the Service Project Submission form on the BETA Website!

    • Cards can be dropped off at Ms. Cook’s room (1318)

title: Youth Homes Donation Drive
body:
Jesse’s House and Bald Ridge Lodge are youth homes in Forsyth County that take in children in unsafe situations and give them the help and support they need. We are collecting donations for these youth homes so they can continue to support children in need in Forsyth County. This is a collaborative donation drive with SFHS Key Club, and we will be having donation kit making later this semester.

You can donate the following Items:

  • Individually packed snacks

  • Healthy cereal

  • Paper towels

  • Dish soap

  • Dish sponges

  • Swiffer duster replacements

  • Pasta sauce

  • Granola bars

  • Canned beans

  • Popcorn

  • Oatmeal

    • 3 DIFFERENT items = 1 hour

    • Max of two hours

title: Wellroot Donation Drive
body:
Wellroot is a foster care and family service organization that provides short term foster families to children in needs, and help educate teens and young adults to break the cycle of trauma. 


They are looking to collect card games, board games, and craft/activity kits,  to distribute to underprivileged children.


Examples:

Heads Up

Cranium

Trouble

Exploding Kittens

Apples to Apples

Operation

Catan 

Charades

Battleship

Hours:

  • 1  item (must be new) = 1 hour

  • Max of two hours


Donations due: Friday October 14


Drop off location: Ms. Cook’s room (1318)

title: Johns Creek Elementary School Math Night
body:
Johns Creek Elementary School is hosting a family math night on Tuesday September 20th. 


  • The event starts at 5:30 pm, but volunteers will need to arrive 30 to 60 minutes earlier. 

  • Volunteers will be helping out to facilitate at the various math stations.


Please sign up using the link. Further details and instructions about the event and the activities are in the sign up bio, so please read that as well!

links.title: Signup Link
links.href: https://www.signupgenius.com/go/10c0e4dabab29abf94-johns

title: Next Generation Focus
body:
Next Generation Focus is a local tutoring organization that works with underprivileged children in our community to ensure that they succeed in school.

  •  They are looking for volunteers to do either in person or virtual tutoring.

  • Available tutoring times: Monday-Thursday 4:30 - 6:30 PM and Saturdays from 10 AM - 12 PM

  • This is a long term commitment, and they require a minimum of 4 hours per week. If you get enough hours, you can qualify for a Presidential Volunteer Service Award!

If you are interested, please message Ms. Amy at 678-516-5062
